defs: = ಮನಗೂಡು.
to deprive of courage, confidence; to discourage; to dishearten.
to have bad, negative opinion on (another); to dislike; to feel aversion to.
to lose courage or confidence.
to make up one's made; to determine; to take a decision.
= ಮನಗೊಡು.
= ಮನಗೊಳ್.
= ಮನಗೊಳಿಸು.
= ಮನತಣಿ.

to satisfy; to gratify.
to feel diffident; to be deprived of courage, confidence; to be disheartened.
to express one's feeling, thought, etc.
to agree to; to concur.
to be satisfied; to be gratified.
(one's mind) to like; to wish for.
(one's mind, opinion) to undergo or exhibit dichotomy.
to lose courage, confidence; to become discouraged or diffident.
= ಮನಂಬಿಡು.
to make another understand or agree to by explaining, arguing or persuation; to convince.
to like; to have liking for.
to notice; to observe.
= ಮನಬೊಗು.
= ಮನಂಬುಗಿಸು - 1
to gladen; to delight.

fear that is present in one's sub-conscious mind.
extreme dislike or distaste; aversion; antipathy; repugnance.
mental agony.
any hurt or injury to the feelings, honour, etc.
a man whose feelings, honour are hurt.
a woman whose feelings, honour are hurt.
to get one's feelings, honour hurt; to undergo mental distress.
intense feelings of suffering; acute mental pain; the condition of one's feelings disturbed greatly.
intense feelings of suffering; acute mental pain.
mental maturity.
(jain.) the power of reading another's mind, understanding another's thought, feelings, intention, etc. without being expressly conveyed.
with one's free will and agreeably; sincerely and whole-heartedly.

natural mental attitude and customary outlook of mind; disposition.
that makes well liked; endearing.
a beloved man (of a woman).
a beloved woman (of a man).
moral judgement that opposes the violation of a ethical principle and that leads to feelings of guilt if one violates such a principle; conscience.
a man who has lost courage, confidence, etc.
a woman who has lost courage, confidence, etc.
= ಮನಃಕ್ಷತ - 1.
a man of strong will or volition.
courage and fortitude; strong will or volition.
a man who has aversion for pondering, cogitating deeply over.
aversion for thinking deeply or pondering over (something).

the state of being clearly understood or realised.
to make a person agree or understand by explaining, arguing or persuation; to convince.
to understand another opinion, feeling, etc.
(something) to be felt, understood, perceived, etc.
to grasp; to observe; to become aware of; to perceive.
to lose courage, confidence; to become diffident.

the natural disposition of the mind.
feelings of intense suffering; acute mental pain; agitation in the mind.
(feelings, wishes, attutudes, interest, etc. of two persons) to match (with each other).
internal happiness; hapiness felt deeply within.
to pay interest or attention to.
to attract, charm or fascinate the mind.
to be attracted by; to be charmed or fascinated.
to be beautiful, charming.
to like; to be inclined towards.
to attract (the mind by one's beauty); to charm, fascinate.
to please; to be pleasant to.
to cause to agree to by convincing; to convince.
to be beautiful.
(the mind, feeling) to get satisfied.
to long for; to want; to wish.
to be understood or realised clearly.
the state of being convinced (completely).

a man who is beloved (to a woman).
a woman who is beloved (to a man).
= ಮನತರು.
to turn away (from something) in repugnance, dislike, etc.
to convey, in an open manner, to another one's inner feelings, thoughts, wishes, disappointments, etc.
absence of clarity in understanding; confusion and resulting disorder.
a natural habit or characteristic tendency in a person; disposition.
a calm, lengthy, intent consideration as by fixing the mind on the subject; reflection; meditation.
to think deeply, consider intently by concentrating the mind on the subject.
fit or proper to concentrate, cogitate or meditate on.
a subject, thing, that is fit to concentrate, cogitate or meditate on.
to be filled with high spirits, optimism, etc.; to be elated or to have enthusiasm.
= ಮನಪೆಚ್ಚು.
(fig.) a man who is mentally very weak.
= ಮನಬರಡ.
= ಮನದೆಱೆ.
that which causes a feeling of extreme repugnance or aversion.
to make an impression on the mind.
to attract, charm or fascinate (the mind).
to be satisfied, gratified.
the quality or state of (the mind) being frail; weakness of the mind.
more than required, specified; very plentiful; abundant.
= ಮನತಣಿ.
a man not having self-restraint; he who carries out his will or wishes stubbornly and carelessly.
(courage, spirit, confidence) to be lost.
to have a desire for.
to be distressed; to undergo mental suffering.
to be understood or realised clearly.
anger that is not expressed.
to turn away one's attention (from something).
to put the thinking faculty into action.

dislike; repugnance; aversion.
he who spoils the cordial relation that exists between two persons.
to get satisfaction; to be satisfied.
that which is very much liked or is very dear.

capturing the interest and attention; fascinating.
a good-looking, handsome man.
illusion or hallucination.
attraction; fascination.
the charming beauty or loveliness.

an activity that diverts the tired, disgusted mind and provides recreation to it; entertainment.
the state of being convinced (completely).
ಮನವರಿಕೆಮಾಡು manavarike māḍu to convince (a person) about (something); to persuade someone to agree with or to do something; to bring (someone) around.
to make (someone) agree, understand or realise the truth or validity (of something); to convince.
= ಮನತಣಿ.
= ಮನವಾರ್ತೆ.
the domestic works.
a man employed for domestic work; a domestic servant.

a request for help, sympathy, etc.; an appeal.
a written application made in this regard.

to be dissatisfied, disappointed, frustrated.
= ಮನಮಿಡು.
a man who appeals for help, sympathy, etc.
a man who appeals to a higher court to review the decision of a lower court.
the state or quality of being partial; a favourable leaning towards one person or party, showing dislike, disapproval or disfavour towards another or others; biasedness; partiality.
(spirits) to be lost or depressed.
to lose spirits, enthusiasm; to be depressed.
to pay attention to.
to wish, desire for.
(spirits) to get boosted.

to fix attention firmly on.
= ಮನವಿ.
to mentally bow in obeisance; to pay mental homage.
to have a strong desire for.

to be to (one's) liking.
to accept, agree.
to like.

to cause to agree, accept (by convincing).
to become delighted from satisfaction or joy.
= ಮನವೊಪ್ಪು.
= ಮನವೊಪ್ಪು.

(fem.) a specialist in psyhology; a psyhologist.

a secret, hostile, unlawful or evil plan; a plot.

the lethargic attitude that makes a person lazy.
(the mind) to be engrossed or absorbed in.
to make up one's mind (to do something); to decide.
to like; to incline toward; to prefer (something, over another or others).
(the mind) to get satisfied.

as to or to the extent to satisfy oneself fully.
Manmatha, the God of Love.
love; passion.
any activity or activities that arouse and excite sexual appetite; the amatory sport.
the element, part, substance or process (in a human or other conscious being) that reasons, thinks, feels, wills, perceives, judges, etc.; the mind.
the totality of all the mental activities and powers.
a wish or desire.
the result of thinking process; a mental form or picture; imagination, feeling or opinion.
an intention, purpose or aim.
a feeling of intentness, concern; interest.
ಮನಸೋ ಇಚ್ಛೆ manasō icche without following any order, discipline; capriciously; fancifully; whimsically; 2. without reason or forethought; influenced by the momenṭs spur.
an intention or determination to do a specified thing or act in a specified manner.
a trickery; an artifice.
= ಮನಸುಬ.
readiness or liberality in giving generosity.
freedom from meanness or smallness of mind or character.
at attract, captivate the mind.
without reason, judgement, forethought; capriciously.

to be carried away by.
concentrating on; engrossed in; having interest in.

to take into mind; to consider; to think over.
to wish or desire for.
attention of the mind.
the act of wishing; felt or expressed desire for something.

a diminishing of one's courage, confidence or enthusiasm.
mental pain, suffering, discomfort, etc.; distress; mental agony.
an active hostility between two persons; antagonism.
emotional pain caused by separation of one's lover; pangs of separation.
the state of the mind.
mental and emotional strength in facing difficulty, adversity, danger or temptation courageously; mettle; fortitude.
a man who is having or showing a proper pride in oneself, one's position, one's family, etc.
an intelligent, brilliant man.
in a manner subject to, led by or indicative of caprice or whim; irrationally; erratically; capriciously; whimsically.

an intelligent, brilliant woman.
the fact of the mind being preoccupied with the sensory objects.
moral judgement that opposes the violation of a ethical principle and that leads to feelings of guilt if one violates such a principle; conscience.
the element, part, substance or process (in a human or other conscious being) that reasons, thinks, feels, wills, perceives, judges, etc.; the mind.
the totality of all the mental activities and powers.
a wish or desire.
the result of thinking process; a mental form or picture; imagination, feeling or opinion.
an intention, purpose or aim.

ಮನಸ್ಸನ್ನು ಕಲ್ಲುಮಾಡಿಕೊ manassannu kallu māḍiko to make the mind hard; to have firmness and fortitude; ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ಹಚ್ಚಿಕೊ manassige hacciko to take into the mind deeply; to think too seriously about; ಮನಸ್ಸಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಮಂಡಿಗೆ ತಿನ್ನು manassinalli maṇḍige tinnu to be unreasonably, impracticably hopeful or optimistic; ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ಬರು manassige baru to be convinced; ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ತೆಗೆದುಕೊ manassige tegeduko = ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ಹಚ್ಚಿಕೊ; ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ಕಡಿವಾಣ ಹಾಕು manassige kaḍivāṇa hāku to restrain one's desires or ambitions; ಮನಸ್ಸು ಕಲ್ಲಾಗು manassu kallāgu (the mind) to become hard, unemotional, impassive or unconcerned; 2. (determine to face the danger) to become hard; ಮನಸ್ಸು ಮುರಿ manassu muri (friendship, companionship, alliance, harmony etc.) to be lost between two persons; ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ಹಿಡಿ manassige hiḍi to be liked (very much); to become agreeable to; ಮನಸ್ಸು ಜೋಲುಬಿಡು manassu jōlu biḍu to lose enthusiasm, courage or confidence;ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ಹತ್ತಿಸಿಕೊ manassige hattisiko = ಮನಸ್ಸಿಗೆ ಹಚ್ಚಿಕೊ; ಮನಸ್ಸು ಹಾಕು manassu hāku to have or show interest in; ಮನಸ್ಸು ಹಗುರಾಗು manassu hagurāgu (the burden oon one's mind) to be relieved; ಮನಸ್ಸು ಬಿಚ್ಚು manassu biccu to tell, convey or reveal one's inner feelings, thoughts, intention, etc. (to another).
confident expectation, anticipation or hope; trust.
a fickle-minded, capricious man.
a fickle-minded, capricious woman.
= ಮನಹೀನ.
an obstruction; a hindrance.
a lofty, often slender, tower or turret attached to a mosque, with one or more balconies, from which the muezzin or crier calls the people to prayer; a minaret.
a tower or a tower-like structure projecting a very bright light guiding ships about the routes or warning about the dangers; a light house.
the act of sending an amount of money to another person through postal system, on payment of specified charges; money-order.
the plant Musa textilis of Musaceae family; Demon plantain; Manilla hemp.
a scholarly man; a very learned man.
a man worthy of respect or reverence by reason of scholarship, wisdom and dignity.
power of judging rightly and following the soundest course of action, based on knowledge, experience, understanding, intuition, meditation; etc.; good judgement; sagacity; wisdom.
the act of wishing; felt or expressed desire.
an intention; purpose.
a prosodic verse, in praise of a deity or expounding a cosmic truth, esp. in a symbolic manner; a hymn.
(myth.) the father of mankind; the man par excellence.
any of the fourteen sons of Brahma, the Creator of the universe, who are considered as forefathers of mankind.
(math.) a symbol for the number fourteen.
all human beings; the human race; man-kind.
the conduct that is exemplary for mankind.
a man of such a conduct.
= ಮನುಷ್ಯ.
(jain.) human being, as one of the four kinds of living beings.
= ಮನುಷ್ಯತ್ವ.
= ಮನುಷ್ಯತ್ವ.
= ಮನುಷ್ಯತ್ವ.
a ruler; a king.

a female human being.

the path laid down by Manu, in his code, for people to follow.
a man who abides by this code.
= ಮನುಕುಲ.
= ಮನವಿ.
a human being.
= ಮನುಜಗತಿ.
= ಮನುಕುಲ.
the fact or quality of being human; human nature; humanity.
the qualities or characteristics, that are desirable in every human, as kindness, sympathy, compassion, benevolence, fraternity, etc.
Kubēra, the Regent of Wealth.
the social, moral duties of a man as a human being.
he whose conduct, qualities conform to that of human beings.
human effort (as distinguished from that of destiny).
hospitality and respect shown to guests, as one of the five sacrifices a human being has to observe.
the earth, as the abode of human beings.
that can be carried by a man or people in gen.
that (as a load) which can be carried by a man or people in gen.

a detailed code in Samskřta, ascribed to Svāyambhuva Manu, (prob. written in third or second century BC) that lays down the laws, practices, ethics for Hindus, and which was taken by British Government in India as a basis for framing laws and rules.
dried, dark-blue grapes.
a building where a person or family normally lives; a house.
a space enclosed by walls, within a house, separating it from other portions (as ಅಡುಗೆಮನೆ, ಊಟದ ಮನೆ, etc.).
the line of descendants of a particular ancestor; family; lineage.
parents and their children, considered as a group; lineage.
any of several, usu. square figure drawn, painted, etc. to play on (as in chess, dice-game, kuṇṭebille, caukābāra, etc.).
any of several keys of a musical instrument (as piano, harmonium, etc.).
any of musical notes in C-major, taken as a tonic note or base for singing or playing.

ಮನೆ ಪಾಲಾಗು mane pālāgu (a house) to be disintegrated; the property (as house, land, cash, etc.) to be divided amongst children (or co-heirs); ಮನೆ ಮಾಡು mane māḍu to build a house; 2. to settle (oneself) at a place; 3. to take a house for rent; 4. (an impression, feeling, etc.) to make a long-lasting dent or impression on the mind; ಮನೆ ಮಾರು mane māru (pl.) a house and household things; ಮನೆ ಮುರಿ mane muri to ruin a family; ಮನೆ ಕುರುಕ್ಷೇತ್ರವಾಗು mane kurukśetravāgu (a house) to become a place for quarrel (amongst its family members); ಮನೆ ತೊಳೆ mane toḷe to destress very much or ruin a family; ಮನೆ ಚೊಕ್ಕಟ ಮಾಡು mane cokkaṭa māḍu = ಮನೆ ತೊಳೆ; ಮನೆಗೆ ಮಾರಿ ಊರಿಗೆ (ಪರರಿಗೆ) ಉಪಕಾರಿ manege māri, ūrige(pararige) upakāri (prov.) (said of a person who helps others, but not one's own family) it is no good hen that cackles in your house and lays eggs in another's; ಮನೆ ರಣರಂಗವಾಗು mane raṇa rangavāgu = ಮನೆ ಕುರುಕ್ಷೇತ್ರವಾಗು; ಮನೆ ಹಿಡಿ mane hiḍi to stay within the house (without going out); 2. to take a house for rent; ಕೊಟ್ಟ ಮನೆ koṭṭa mane (said of a woman) one's husbands house; ಮನೆ ಕಟ್ಟಿನೋಡು, ಮದುವೆ ಮಾಡಿನೋಡು mane kaṭṭi nōḍu, maduve māḍi nōḍu the difficulty of marrying one's daughter or building a house, can be understood only by one's own experience; ಮನೆ ಒಡೆ mane oḍe to disintegrate the members of a family; to ruin a family; ಮನೆಯಳಿಯ maneyaḷiya a man who permanently stays in his wife's parents' house; ಮನೆಯಳಿಯತನ maneyaḷiyatana the fact of a man permanently staying in his wife's parents' house; 2. a system prevalent in some parts, that the man to whom one's daughter is given in marriage, stays in the family of his wife; ಮನೆಯಾಕೆ maneyāke the mistress of a house; 2. a woman as related to a man whom she has married to; ಸೇರಿದ ಮನೆ sērida mane ಕೊಟ್ಟ ಮನೆ ಮನೆಯವರು maneyaru a man as related to his wife; a husband.

the routine expenses of a house.
